awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: UAM Routing and vertiport pad assignment: A mathematical optimization model and case study
publications.publisher: Spring Joint Conference of KORMS and KIIE
publications.summary: This study develops a mathematical optimization model for UAM routing and vertiport pad assignment that considers pad capacity, occupancy, and charging constraints, applying a rolling horizon approach to handle real-time operations. Tested with K-UAM demonstration route data, the model highlights the necessity of pad-level constraints for practical UAM scheduling.

publications.name: Design of a multidimensional urban logistics network: Optimizing the simultaneous location of UAM vertiports and ground logistics hubs
publications.publisher: Spring Joint Conference of KORMS and KIIE
publications.summary: This study proposes a bi-objective mathematical optimization model for the simultaneous location of UAM vertiports and ground logistics hubs using administrative data from Seoul. The results present optimal strategies to enhance the efficiency of urban logistics systems and provide guidelines for infrastructure development.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
